intro: Acinodendron rubens, commonly known as the red-flowered acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, bright red flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
